entries.meaning: a cylindrical recess, typically machined around a hole to admit a screw so that it sits flush with a surface.

verbs.description: countersink (third-person singular simple present countersinks, present participle countersinking, simple past countersank, past participle countersunk)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To create such a conical recess.
examples: to countersink a hole for a screw

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to sink even with or below the surface.
examples: to countersink a screw or bolt into woodwork
